alert.note: Alert for Lower Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Upper Koyukuk Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 30 at 7:45PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...The Koyukuk River from Allakaket to Hughes, the Kobuk River below Ambler, the Noatak River * WHEN...Through Friday morning. * IMPACTS...High water continues to move down the Koyukuk River, Kobuk River, and the Noatak River. Water levels are at or near bankfull with minor flooding possible in some low-lying locations. Gravel bars are covered with water along with increased debris in these rivers and the threat of erosion. On the Koyukuk River, the crest of high water passed Allakaket today and is expected to reach Hughes Wednesday night. On the Kobuk River, the crest of high water will pass Kiana by Thursday morning. On the Noatak River, the crest of high water is expected to reach Noatak Thursday night. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Runoff from recent heavy rain across the Brooks Range from the Dalton Highway west continues to move down the Koyukuk River, Kobuk River, and Noatak River. Additional rain is expected over this area Thursday night through this weekend. - Http://weather/gov/aprfc
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Lower Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Upper Koyukuk Valley
